title: Multiple Positions ‚Äì Central Poultry (2000) Limited
description:
Closes :  June 5, 2025

Full Time
Lilongwe
Posted 4 days ago





Central Poultry (2000) Limited 



CENTRAL POULTRY (2000) LIMITED
JOIN OUR TEAM ‚Äì EXCITING CAREER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE POULTRY INDUSTRY
Are you ready to take the next step in your career with a dynamic company at the forefront of poultry operations in Malawi? Central Poultry (2000) Limited is looking for qualified, experienced, and motivated professionals to join our growing team in the following key roles in Lilongwe:
1. Senior Production Manager
Qualifications & Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering (Mechanical or Industrial preferred)
Minimum 10 years of experience in production management within manufacturing or FMCG industries
Proven ability to lead teams, streamline operations, and enhance production efficiency
Strong leadership, analytical, and communication skills

2. Warehouse Manager
Qualifications & Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
Minimum 10 years of experience in warehouse operations and inventory management
Strong understanding of warehouse safety standards, storage systems, and ERP software
Excellent leadership, organizational, and planning capabilities

3. Maintenance Manager ‚Äì Abattoir
Qualifications & Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical)
At least 10 years of experience in industrial maintenance, preferably in food processing or manufacturing environments
Proven track record in managing preventive and corrective maintenance programs
Strong technical troubleshooting and team management skills

4. Head of Sales

Qualifications & Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Sales, Marketing, Business Administration, or related field (Master‚Äôs Degree is an added advantage)
Minimum 12 years of progressive experience in sales, including at least 5 years in a senior leadership role
Strong knowledge of sales strategy, market development, and customer relationship management
Experience in the FMCG sectors 
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and collaborate with marketing, production, and logistics departments
Exceptional communication, leadership, and decision-making skills

5. Senior Accountant
Qualifications & Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field (ACCA/CIMA qualification preferred)
Minimum 10 years of progressive accounting experience, including at least 5 years in auditing or working in an audit environment
Strong understanding of financial reporting, budgeting, tax compliance, and internal controls
Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., Sage, SAP, or similar ERP systems)
Excellent analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills

Application Instructions:
If you‚Äôre interested, please submit your detailed CV, cover letter, and copies of relevant certificates (as one document) to recruitment@capsmw.com by 5th June, 2025. Please clearly indicate the position you are applying for in the subject line ofyour email.
Join Central Poultry (2000) Limited and be part of a team that‚Äôs shaping the future of Malawi‚Äôs poultry industry!
CP is an equal opportunity employer. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.





To apply for this job email your details to recruitment@capsmw.com

title: Human Resources Assistant
company: St. John of God Hospitaller Services
description:
Closes :  May 30, 2025

Full Time
Mzuzu
Posted 1 day ago





St. John of God Hospitaller Services 



St John of God Hospitaller Services Malawi is a non-profit faith-based healthcare organization established in 1994 to contribute to the development of health for all Malawians including the most vulnerable, marginalized and excluded groups. With its operations in both Lilongwe and Mzuzu, St John of God Malawi is a key provider of tertiary and community based mental health promotion and care; early intervention services, special need and inclusive education for children with both intellectual and
physical disability; vocational training for orphans & vulnerable youth including those with disability; health care and ancillary services for older persons; psychosocial counselling, stress and addiction management services; rehabilitation of street children; self-help group approach for women empowerment and tertiary level training in Psychiatric Nursing, Clinical Medicine- Psychiatry
& Mental Health, Psychosocial Counselling and General Nursing.
SJOG would like to fill the following positions based in Mzuzu:
Human Resources Assistant
Reporting to the Human Resources and Administration Officer, the HR Assistant will be expected to support the Human Resources department and JOG operations with administrative and operational tasks.
Responsibilities (which include, but are not limited to):

Assist in recruitment processes, including posting job adverts, screening CVs, and scheduling interviews.
Maintain employee records and update HR databases.
Handle HR-related documentation such as contracts, leave requests, and disciplinary records.
Support payroll processing by collecting and verifying attendance and overtime data.
Assist in organising training sessions and employee engagement activities.
Respond to HR-related queries and provide general administrative support.
Ensure compliance with SJOG policies and labour laws.

Requirements

Diploma in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or a related field
At least 3-5 years of experience in an HR or administrative role.
Familiarity with HR software and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
High level of confidentiality and attention to detail.
Strict adherence to the Organisation‚Äôs Child and Vulnerable Adult protection policy
Willingness to work with people suffering from mental health-related problems and their families.

How to Apply
Applications with detailed Curriculum Vitae, cover letter and names of three traceable referees should be submitted to the following addresses:
The Chief Executive Officer,
St. John of God Hospitaller Services,
P. O. Box 744
MZUZU
Email: recruitment@sjog.mw
Closing date: Friday, 30th May, 2025.




To apply for this job email your details to recruitment@sjog.mw

title: Chief Finance Officer
description:
Closes :  June 6, 2025

Full Time
Lilongwe
Posted 1 day ago





Export Development Fund Limited 



Organisation Background
Export Development Fund (EDF) is a development finance institution (DFI) mandated to promote the growth as well as diversification of the country‚Äôs exports. EDF‚Äôs mission is to support the Malawi economy through provision of foreign trade solutions to facilitate export diversification, international competitiveness and inclusive growth.
EDF also plays a leading role in job creation by investing in ambitious projects and initiatives, with the aim of enhancing the competitiveness of Malawi‚Äôs exports.
EDF‚Äôs young and dynamic team is motivated towards the collective goal of transforming Malawi‚Äôs exporting sector for accelerated economic development.
An exciting opportunity has arisen for energetic and innovative individuals to join EDF. We are therefore inviting applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions:
CHIEF FINANCE OFFICER
Reporting to the Managing Director, the Chief Finance Officer‚Äôs overall responsibility is to oversee EDF‚Äôs financial management to ensure value for money, sound performance, and organizational sustainability. In addition, the role oversees the administration, human resources and ICT functions towards providing efficient and effective business support for growth. The CFO is also required to participate in strategy and policy setting for the organization.
Key responsibilities include the following:
a. Developing the finance strategy and objectives for approval by the Board.
b. Overseeing budgeting and forecasting, including drafting annual and multi-year budgets, building strategic business goals into budget KPIs, implementation, monitoring and evaluation, and remedial measures.
c. Implementing efficient and effective cash flow planning and management, including implementation of short-term, medium-term and long-term rolling cash flow forecasting, multi-year cash flow forecasts integrated with multi-year income statement and balance sheet forecasts, weekly cash flow analysis and optimization, and emergency cash reserves management.
d. Managing and controlling working capital of the Fund in line with business needs.
e. Managing and controlling the capital structure of the Fund through efficient and effective treasury management, including regularly liquidity and solvency analysis, regular market scanning for financing opportunities and borrowing cost savings, and balance sheet optimization.
f. Providing leadership to all reporting functions, namely Finance, Treasury, Administration/Procurement, Human Resources and ICT.
g. Maintaining the integrity of EDF‚Äôs financial information.
h. Assessing and managing financial risks, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and implementing effective financial policies, procedures, and controls.
i. Implementing effective and ethical tax planning to minimize losses to the organization.
j. Providing strategic financial input concerning investments in projects.
k. Implement a robust financial reporting system and ensure 100% compliance with all relevant statutes, standards, regulations, policies, procedures, and guidelines.
l. Managing relationships with external stakeholders, such as MRA, External Auditors and RBM.
m. Advising on long term business and financial planning
Preferred Qualifications, Skills, Experience and Attributes are as follows:

Candidates should possess a master‚Äôs degree e.g., Finance, Business Administration and/or Management plus bachelor‚Äôs degree in accounting or finance obtained from a recognized
and accredited university.
Must possess relevant professional qualifications: ACCA/CIMA etc.
In depth knowledge of risk management practices.
Excellent knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods.
Proficient in the use MS Office and financial management software
Ability to strategize and solve problems
Strong leadership and organisational skills
Excellent communication and people management skills
Knowledge of relevant legislation such as Financial Services Act, Reserve Bank of Malawi Directives, Malawi Company Law, and Taxation Law.
Ability to work within budget, tight deadlines and with limited resources.
Not less than 10 years working experience in a reputable financial institution and at least 5 years‚Äôexperience at senior management level.

Mode of application
Interested candidates should submit their applications clearly indicating the relevant position together with detailed CV and names of three (3) traceable referees by close of business, 6th June 2025 via
email to recruitment@edf.mw. All applications should be addressed to:
The Managing Director
Export Development Fund Limited
First Floor ‚Äì Public Service Pension Fund House
Off Presidential Drive 
P.O. Box 30063
LILONGWE 3.
Only shortlisted applicants shall be acknowledged and invited for interviews.
EDF is an equal opportunity employer as such, women are encouraged to apply




To apply for this job email your details to recruitment@edf.mw

title: Investment Specialist
description:
Closes :  June 6, 2025

Full Time
Lilongwe
Posted 1 day ago





Export Development Fund Limited 



Organisation Background
Export Development Fund (EDF) is a development finance institution (DFI) mandated to promote the growth as well as diversification of the country‚Äôs exports. EDF‚Äôs mission is to support the Malawi economy through provision of foreign trade solutions to facilitate export diversification, international competitiveness and inclusive growth.
EDF also plays a leading role in job creation by investing in ambitious projects and initiatives, with the aim of enhancing the competitiveness of Malawi‚Äôs exports.
EDF‚Äôs young and dynamic team is motivated towards the collective goal of transforming Malawi‚Äôs exporting sector for accelerated economic development.
An exciting opportunity has arisen for energetic and innovative individuals to join EDF. We are therefore inviting applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions:
INVESTMENT SPECIALIST
Reporting to the Manager, Origination & Special Projects, the Investment Specialist is responsible for leading end-to-end operations of business development, due diligence, and the credit risk management processes for high efficiency processes and quality loan book. Particularly, the Investment Specialist will
be responsible for identifying, executing and actively managing infrastructure projects, and other structured deals as well as building a strong pipeline to anchor EDF‚Äôs business growth. The overall goal is to maximize the impact of EDF‚Äôs interventions and contribution to sector and/or industry development by executing innovative, developmental, and financially sustainable investments.
Key responsibilities include the following:

Develop & maintain extensive network of business contacts, to develop new business and generate revenue.
Develop, manage and grow a strong pipeline of good quality investment opportunities consistent with Fund‚Äôs strategic goals.
Identify and evaluate opportunities to increase the developmental impact of new or portfolio projects.
Develop and advise innovative and appropriate financing structures for projects.
Review and develop financial models based on historical information and other available industry specific operating metrics to support investment decisions.
Conduct scenario analysis based on macro and microeconomic fundamentals to support investment activities.
Identify financial and non-financial risks and propose mitigants to inform investment decisions.
Handle oversight and administrative functions for deal closure, compliance and monitoring of approved transactions and ensuring adequate funding for transactions.
Lead portfolio reviews and recommend proactive interventions towards delinquency.
Establish and implement risk and control processes to improve productivity, quality, and customer satisfaction.
Coordinate closely with social, environmental, and technical assistance counterparties to address factors that may impact transactions, find pragmatic solutions to sector specific challenges, and achieve sustainable development impact.
Facilitate feasibility studies (economic, technical, financial, social, environmental, legal etc.) in line with the agreed project preparation Advisory Mandates.
Facilitate financial close for bankable projects

Preferred Qualifications, Skills, Experience and Attributes are as follows:

Minimum of a master‚Äôs degree in finance, Economics, Banking, Business Administration, or related field from a recognized and accredited institution.
Those with a related bachelor‚Äôs degree and with a minimum of over 5 years relevant experience may be considered.
Negotiating and consensus building capabilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Good analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Good planning, organizing skills and team player.
Ability to comprehensively analyze financial statements.
Strong attention to detail and ability to build and analyze financial models.
Good knowledge and understanding of Credit principles, financing of infrastructure projects and general banking practices and procedures.
Ability to build and analyze financial models.
Excellent credit risk analysis and transaction structuring skills.
Result oriented and demonstrable track record of originating and preparing project financing transactions.
Familiarity with types of agreements/contracts typically used in project finance, including relevant legislative framework for Development Finance Institutions.

Mode of application

title: Finance Officer
description:
Closes :  June 10, 2025

Full Time
Lumbadzi
Posted 1 day ago





TAWINA 



POSITION TYPE: Full Time, Local Hire
DURATION: 1 year with extension
LOCATION: Lumbadzi, Malawi
POSITION TITLE: FINANCE OFFICER
REPORTS TO: Board of Trustees and Executive Director
TAWINA is a women led organization that was established in 2009 to support the empowerment, education, training and economic participation of rural women and girls in Malawi. TAWINA targets
socially vulnerable girls who are at risk of becoming a child bride or otherwise being excluded from full participation in Malawian Society. TAWINA has been delivering innovative and customized solutions that improve the health, socio-economic and legal outcomes for female victims of sexual and gender-based violence such as child, early and forced marriage (CEFM), domestic violence, and rape. The primary focus of TAWINA is rural adolescent girls and women who are the guardians and or parents of rural adolescent girls aged 9 to 17 years. TAWINA social enterprise portfolio includes pig value chain development,
soybean production and marketing, and organic vegetable gardening.
POSITION SUMMARY
The Finance Officer for TAWINA will oversee all financial activities to ensure compliance with donor and organizational policies. This role involves managing project budgets and ensuring expenditure
aligns with stipulated guidelines. Key responsibilities include preparing financial statements and reporting following GAAP.
The Finance Officer will also manage cash flow, establish financial controls, handle tax filings and prepare for audits.
Additionally, the Finance Officer will provide documentation for grants, mentor the finance team, and advise management. They will also be responsible for overseeing financial systems and seeking opportunities for process improvements.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Maintenance of computerized accounting system (Xero or internet-based experience preferred)
Daily maintenance and recording of bank transactions, bank reconciliations.
Month end reports for different divisions and consolidation.
Prepare and monitor project budgets, ensuring expenditures align with approved budgets.
Generate accurate financial reports, including cash books, bank reconciliations, and budget compliance reports, for internal and donor use.
Ensure timely submission of financial reports to donors and stakeholders.
Verify and process invoices, bills, and staff reimbursements.
Ensure all payments comply with organizational and donor guidelines.
Maintain financial records in compliance with local tax laws and donor requirements.
Manage restricted and unrestricted funds, ensuring that funds are allocated and used in compliance with donor agreements and organizational policies.
Manage petty cash and ensure accurate recording of daily transactions.
Reconcile bank statements and maintain updated cash and bank books.
Oversee procurement processes, ensuring adherence to organizational policies.
Manage inventory, office supplies, and equipment maintenance.
Assist in recruitment processes, including preparing job descriptions and coordinating interviews.
Maintain employee records, timesheets, and leave balances.
Ensure smooth day-to-day operations, including travel arrangements, vehicle maintenance, and office security.
Maintain organized filing systems for administrative and financial documents.
Collaborate with project teams to ensure financial and administrative support for program activities.
Monitor project expenditures and provide guidance on budget utilization.
Train staff and partners on financial procedures and compliance requirements.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a minimum of 3 years of experience in finance and administration, preferably in NGOs or women empowerment programs.
Proficiency in accounting software e.g. Xero, QuickBooks and Microsoft Office Suite.
Strong knowledge of financial management, budgeting, and donor compliance.
Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Application Process
How to Apply:
Submit a cover letter and CV to: recruitments@tawina.org with the job title in the subject line.
For inquiries, call TAWINA on 0992852417.
Deadline: 10th June 2025.




To apply for this job email your details to recruitments@tawina.org

company: Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited
description:
Full Time
Blantyre, Malawi
Posted 2 days ago





Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited 



The Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited is incorporated under the Companies Act of the Laws of Malawi. Its core business is to procure, transmit and distribute electric power in Malawi as well as manage System Market Operations and Single Buyer in Malawi.
ESCOM is inviting applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the following vacant positions currently existing in the Optic Fiber Directorate of the Corporation.
Senior Engineer ‚Äì Data Center (1 Position)
Grade: ES6
Location: Blantyre
Supervised by : Chief Engineer Operations
Purpose of the Job
To design, maintain, and optimize the power infrastructure for the data centers.
Roles and Responsibilities

Reporting on data centre performance and suggesting improvements.
Creating and maintaining disaster recovery plans to ensure data centre resilience.
Managing data centre infrastructure, such as servers, storage, networking, and cooling systems.
Planning for scalability and redundancy to meet future growth while maintaining high availability.
Overseeing Monitoring and maintenance of power systems (e.g., UPS, generators), cooling systems (e.g., CRAC units), and network infrastructure.
Performing preventive maintenance on a regular basis.
Optimizing Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) and Cooling Efficiency to save energy and money.
Implementing automation technologies (such as DCIM software) to enable real-time monitoring and administration.
Ensuring that data centre infrastructure meets minimum security requirements.
Protecting sensitive data, setting up access controls, firewalls, and encryption.
Performing frequent security audits and vulnerability assessments.
Testing and validating backup and failover mechanisms to reduce downtime during disruptions.
Collaborating with IT teams, vendors, and business units to align data centre operations with organizational requirements.

Attributes and competencies

Deep knowledge of data centre technologies (e.g., servers, storage, power, networking, virtualization).
Proficiency in power and cooling systems (e.g., UPS, PDUs, CRAC units).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and hybrid cloud architectures.
Strong troubleshooting skills.
Ability to explain technical concepts to clients, colleagues, and management, both verbally and in writing.
Understanding and following safety protocols to prevent accidents while working with potentially hazardous equipment.
Efficiently managing workload and completing tasks within deadlines.

Minimum Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in any of the following: Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, Computer Engineering, Electronics, Information Technology
4 Years relevant work experience
Certification in cybersecurity is desired.
Registered Engineer with MEI/ICTAM

title: Temporary Systems Engineer
description:
Temporary
Lilongwe, Malawi
Posted 3 days ago





Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation (EGPAF) 



Lilongwe, Malawi
Part-time
Location of Position: Malawi




Company Description


Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation (EGPAF) is on a mission to create a world where no mother, child, or family is devastated by HIV and AIDS, and we are making an impact. We are a proven leader in the global fight to end HIV and AIDS, and an advocate for every child to live a full and healthy life into adulthood. For more than 30 years, EGPAF has been a leader in meeting urgent needs in pediatric HIV and AIDS in the world‚Äôs most affected regions. We carry out our values of passion, innovation, teamwork, leadership, integrity, excellence and equity every day, while maximizing our impact in the communities we serve. EGPAF currently supports national, district, and local governments, facilities, communities, and non-governmental partners. In 2020, EGPAF‚Äôs global footprint spans 15 countries. To date, EGPAF has supported over 15,000 sites to offer HIV counselling, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment services alongside high-quality family health care. Join us on our fight for an AIDS-free generation!
EGPAF has worked in Malawi since 2001. Today, EGPAF Malawi implements evidence-based HIV prevention, care and treatment interventions in 177 health facilities in nine districts through EGPAF‚Äôs U.S. President‚Äôs Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief/U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (PEPFAR/CDC) ‚Äì funded Achieving HIV Epidemic Control through Scaling Up Quality Testing, Care and Treatment in Malawi.




Job Description


The Temporary Systems Engineer is an experienced, primarily field-based position with a focus on job site execution and process improvement. The position requires Server Administration knowledge, extensive experience performing similar work in a busy and demanding environment, strong communication, strong organizational skills, and a willingness to work overtime and in remote areas. The engineer will be responsible for executing tasks assigned by the Senior Power Hardware Engineer, maintaining a clean work environment, and interacting in a friendly manner with end users.
No two days are alike at EGPAF, but what can you expect in this role?

Lead and oversee all installation, configuration, support, and troubleshooting of all data center and virtualized environment-related issues.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of the data center design and architecture.
Identify gaps and suggest improvements to ensure optimally performing services hosted in the data center.
Follow up on all reported data center issues and ensure they are resolved in a timely manner.
Effectively monitor all services in the data center to ensure high availability and minimize downtime.
Schedule server and data center updates on all systems, ensuring optimal performance after updates.
Report and follow up with service providers on third-party-related issues.
Provide overall solutions to all server and data center infrastructure-related issues logged by the Service Desk.
Plan maintenance of all IT infrastructure and ensure it is carried out according to established guidelines.
Conduct daily reviews of fault/incident logs to identify recurring issues.
Carry out user management and administration work on the MOH domain in accordance with approved access levels.
Conduct security checks on the MOH server and data center infrastructure in conjunction with IT Security to ensure compliance.
Manage and enforce Cybersecurity policies and practices to protect data and infrastructure from threats and vulnerabilities.
Participate in project implementation as assigned.
Ensure that operating systems and other software products are installed and configured according to IT best practice standards.





Qualifications



Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or Advanced Diploma in computer science, information technology or related technical discipline or equivalent education and experience.
5+ years of experience with VMWare, KVM Virtualization solution and Veeam Backup and replication.
5+ years of experience with Datacentre Monitoring.
5+ years of experience with Server Virtualization.
5+ years of experience with services such as DNS, DHCP, SNMP, SMTP, FTP, HTTPS.





Additional Information



Subject matter expert experience installing, maintaining, and configuring Virtual environment and Storage Systems.
Working experience in a maintenance role in a similar environment and dealt with continuous maintenance and support.
Experience in Datacentre Preventative Maintenance.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Good communication skills.
Knowledge of OpenStack and Proxmox will be an added advantage

As a global, multinational, and multicultural organization, EGPAF believes that diversity in the workplace enriches our work and enhances our impact and effectiveness. We believe that employees have the right to work in a climate of mutual respect and integrity that promotes dignity and respect for all, and that enables them to reach their full potential. EGPAF is an equal opportunity employer and affords equal opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to country law requirements, EGPAF complies with US laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the Foundation has facilities.
The Foundation does not charge any fees at any stage of the recruitment process. If you are asked to pay a fee, please contact our hotline by phone (US: dial toll free 888-225-1429; all other countries: collect 770-776-5674), or online (www.reportlineweb.com/pedaids).
Apply Now

title: Expressions of Interest ‚Äì Numeracy/Maths Reform Project in Malawi
description:
Closes :  June 13, 2025

Consultancy
Lilongwe
Posted 2 days ago





Education Development Trust 






About the role







We are currently preparing to bid for a new 18 month FCDO funded project commencing October 2025 to complete the National Mathematics Curriculum Reform (NMCR). The reform benefits all learners in Standards 1‚Äì4 through improved materials, trained teachers, and a curriculum focused on conceptual understanding.
The suggested components of the programme are:

Strengthen material development and textbook publishing with a focus on sustainability.
Design and implement a pre-service training curriculum under the leadership of the Ministry of Education and Malawi Institute of Education.
Develop and strengthen the roll-out of training on a new numeracy curriculum for teachers.

We would like to hear from education professionals based in Malawi with strong expertise in the following areas;

Programme Leadership
Early Grade Numeracy/Mathematics
Monitoring and Evaluation
Teaching Material/Textbook Production








About the organisation








At Education Development Trust, we improve school systems at scale; we partner with governments around the world to help turn ambitious, visionary education policy into reality. We invest annually in our programme of education research and this evidence underpins our work and informs policy and practice around the world. We have a long-established presence in Africa ‚Äì running programmes since 1992 ‚Äì and have worked with a range of governments, donor agencies and partners to improve education across the continent, providing short-term, expert consultancy and delivering long-term, national education programmes.¬†We have specialist expertise in sustainable school system reform at scale ‚Äì from improving literacy and numeracy outcomes, to large-scale teacher training and strengthening the capacity of national ministries. We are experienced in leading complex programmes in challenging environments and we also work with like-minded organisations to ensure we maximise our impact.
All offers of employment will be subject to satisfactory references and appropriate screening checks, which can include criminal record checks. Education Development Trust also participates in the Inter-Agency Misconduct Disclosure Scheme, and we may request information from relevant job applicants‚Äô previous employers about any findings of sexual misconduct, including harassment, during employment, or incidents under investigation when the applicant left employment. By submitting an application, the job applicant confirms his/her understanding of these recruitment procedures.

Please note, we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close our vacancies early.


We understand that¬†artificial intelligence (AI)¬†tools¬†(such as ChatGPT) can be helpful when applying for jobs ‚Äì especially for those who require additional support during the recruitment process. However, while you may decide to use AI tools for ideas or pointers, we request that you do not rely heavily on them when answering questions. We are looking for responses that are personal to you, including details and examples of your abilities and work experience to date, and we consider copying and pasting AI-generated responses to be a misuse of AI tools. Likewise, we do not use AI-driven recruitment screening software, because we value authenticity and prefer to make personal connections with our candidates. If you have used AI to support your application ‚Äì including in emails and responses to questions ‚Äì please disclose this on your application form. If you would like clarification on how AI can be used in your application to EDT, please contact¬†globalresourcing@edt.org








To apply for this job please visit careers.educationdevelopmenttrust.com.

title: Senior Human Resources and Administration Officer
company: Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited
description:
Full Time
Blantyre, Malawi
Posted 2 days ago





Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited 



The Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited is incorporated under the Companies Act of the Laws of Malawi. Its core business is to procure, transmit and distribute electric power in Malawi as well as manage System Market Operations and Single Buyer in Malawi.
ESCOM is inviting applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the following vacant positions currently existing in the Optic Fiber Directorate of the Corporation.
Senior Human Resources and Administration Officer (1 Position)
Grade: ES6
Location: Blantyre
Supervised by: Director
Purpose of the Job
To provide leadership in human resource and administration functions.
Roles and Responsibilities

Preparing employment contracts in coordination with departmental heads and ensure alignment with HR policies and labor laws.
Overseeing recruitment, placement, performance management, and staff movements such as promotions, transfers, and dismissals.
Planning, coordinating, and evaluating staff training and development initiatives.
Managing staff leave, advances, loans, entitlements, and welfare programs including payroll administration.
Interpreting and implementing HR practices, regulations, and legal requirements.
Developing and enforcing administrative policies and procedures, managing office facilities, furniture, and inventory.
Organizing internal and external events and monitoring office space allocations.
Providing secretarial support to the Disciplinary Committee
Ensuring timely payment of utility expenses

Attributes and competencies

Impeccable skills in Microsoft office packages (Excel, Word, PowerPoint etc.)
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Ability to operate effectively both independently and as part of a team
Good understanding of labor laws governing employment in Malawi

Minimum Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Human Resource Management, Public Administration, Business Administration from an accredited University
Be a registered member of a Professional Body e.g., IPMM
4 years‚Äô relevant practical experience

APPLICATION METHOD: Hard Copies in an envelope clearly indicating the position applied for on top.
ATTACHMENTS: Application Letter, Curriculum Vitae with traceable referees and Copies of Certificates
CLOSING DATE: Wednesday, 25th June 2025.
ADDRESSED TO :
Director of Human Resources and Administration,
ESCOM House,
P. O. Box 2047,
Blantyre.
Only candidates possessing accredited Qualifications will be considered for interviews
ESCOM Ltd is an equal opportunity employer


Share this:Like this:Like Loading...

title: Sales and Marketing Officer (2 Positions)
company: Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited
description:
Full Time
Blantyre and Lilongwe
Posted 2 days ago





Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited 



The Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited is incorporated under the Companies Act of the Laws of Malawi. Its core business is to procure, transmit and distribute electric power in Malawi as well as manage System Market Operations and Single Buyer in Malawi.
ESCOM is inviting applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the following vacant positions currently existing in the Optic Fiber Directorate of the Corporation.
Sales and Marketing Officer (2 Positions)
Grade: ES7
Location: Blantyre and Lilongwe
Supervised by: Senior Sales and Marketing Officer
Purpose of the Job
To identify potential clients, provide products or services, and close sales to help the business develop.
Roles and Responsibilities

Building and maintaining strong relationships with existing clients and new prospects.
Conducting product demonstrations and presentations to showcase value propositions.
Attending to client inquiries and providing tailormade solutions.
Identifying potential customers through cold calling, networking, and digital channels.
Maintaining a pipeline of prospects and tracking of progress using CRM.
Managing the end-to-end sales process
Negotiating terms, pricing, and contracts to secure profitable agreements.
Ensuring timely follow-ups to move prospects through the sales funnel.
Providing information about industry trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences
Maintaining accurate records of sales activities, client interactions, and deals in the CRM system.
Preparing regular reports on sales performance, pipeline status, and revenue forecasts.
Working closely with marketing to align sales efforts with promotional campaigns.

Attributes and competencies

Skilled in negotiation, persuasion, and deal closure across B2B or B2C environments.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present ideas confidently.
Deep understanding of customer needs and a commitment to delivering tailored value.
Experienced in analysing sales data to spot trends and opportunities, with working knowledge of CRM and sales automation tools

Minimum Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in either Marketing, Customer Services, Business Administration or Engineering
3 Years relevant work experience
Registered with CIM

APPLICATION METHOD: Hard Copies in an envelope clearly indicating the position applied for on top.
ATTACHMENTS: Application Letter, Curriculum Vitae with traceable referees and Copies of Certificates
CLOSING DATE: Wednesday, 25th June 2025.
ADDRESSED TO :
Director of Human Resources and Administration,
ESCOM House,
P. O. Box 2047,
Blantyre.
Only candidates possessing accredited Qualifications will be considered for interviews
ESCOM Ltd is an equal opportunity employer

title: Engineer ‚Äì Data Center
company: Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited
description:
Full Time
Blantyre, Malawi
Posted 2 days ago





Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited 



The Electricity Supply Corporation of Malawi (ESCOM) Limited is incorporated under the Companies Act of the Laws of Malawi. Its core business is to procure, transmit and distribute electric power in Malawi as well as manage System Market Operations and Single Buyer in Malawi.
ESCOM is inviting applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the following vacant positions currently existing in the Optic Fiber Directorate of the Corporation.
Engineer ‚Äì Data Center (1 Position)
Grade: ES7
Location: Blantyre
Supervised by: Senior Engineer ‚Äì Data center
Purpose of the Job
To help in designing, maintaining, and optimizing the power infrastructure of data centers.
Roles and Responsibilities

Overseeing the installation of power distribution systems
Planning for redundancy and failover mechanisms to ensure 24/7 uptime.
Integrating energy sources to ensure power sustainability.
Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of power systems to prevent failures.
Diagnosing and resolving power-related issues
Monitoring Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) and implementing strategies to reduce energy consumption.
Implementing dynamic power management to allocate resources based on workload demands.
Ensuring compliance with electrical codes.
Conducting risk assessments and implement emergency response plans for power failures.
Monitoring power usage and system performance using DCIM tools.

Attributes and competencies

In-depth knowledge of electrical engineering concepts including AC/DC systems, three-phase power, UPS systems, generators, and power distribution networks.
Familiar with renewable energy systems, energy storage solutions, and analyzing power usage data for optimization.
Strong ability to quickly resolve power-related issues and strictly adhere to safety protocols when handling hazardous equipment.
Capable of clearly explaining complex technical concepts to nontechnical stakeholders.

Minimum Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering
3 Years relevant experience
Registered with MEl

APPLICATION METHOD: Hard Copies in an envelope clearly indicating the position applied for on top.
ATTACHMENTS: Application Letter, Curriculum Vitae with traceable referees and Copies of Certificates
CLOSING DATE: Wednesday, 25th June 2025.
ADDRESSED TO :
Director of Human Resources and Administration,
ESCOM House,
P. O. Box 2047,
Blantyre.
Only candidates possessing accredited Qualifications will be considered for interviews
ESCOM Ltd is an equal opportunity employer

title: Temporary Electronics Artisan
description:
Temporary
Lilongwe, Malawi
Posted 3 days ago





Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation (EGPAF) 



Lilongwe, Malawi
Part-time
Location of Position: Malawi




Company Description


Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation (EGPAF) is on a mission to create a world where no mother, child, or family is devastated by HIV and AIDS, and we are making an impact.¬†We are a proven leader in the global fight to end HIV and AIDS, and an advocate for every child to live a full and healthy life into adulthood. For more than 30 years, EGPAF has been a leader in meeting urgent needs in pediatric HIV and AIDS in the world‚Äôs most affected regions. We carry out our values of passion, innovation, teamwork, leadership, integrity, excellence and equity every day, while maximizing our impact in the communities we serve. EGPAF currently supports national, district, and local governments, facilities, communities, and non-governmental partners. In 2020, EGPAF‚Äôs global footprint spans 15 countries. To date, EGPAF has supported over 15,000 sites to offer HIV counselling, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment services alongside high-quality family health care.¬†Join us on our fight for an AIDS-free generation!
EGPAF has worked in Malawi since 2001. Today, EGPAF Malawi implements evidence-based HIV prevention, care and treatment interventions in 177 health facilities in nine districts through EGPAF‚Äôs U.S. President‚Äôs Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief/U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (PEPFAR/CDC) ‚Äì funded Achieving HIV Epidemic Control through Scaling Up Quality Testing, Care and Treatment in Malawi.




Job Description


The¬† Temporary Electronics Artisan is an experienced, primarily field-based position with a focus on electronics repair and job site execution and process improvement. The position requires Solar Photovoltaic knowledge, extensive experience performing similar work in the residential and commercial sectors, strong communication, strong organizational skills, and a willingness to work overtime and in remote areas. The Artisan will be responsible for executing tasks assigned by the HIS Zonal Coordinator, maintaining a clean work environment, and interacting in a friendly manner with end users.
No two days are alike at EGPAF, but what can you expect in this role?

Troubleshoot, Repair, Maintain and calibrate all project hardware ranging from Inverters, POS units, Servers, Printers etc.
Document all improvements and changes to reflect status of the power logic in facilities. i.e. circuit and block diagrams
Install photovoltaic systems in accordance with codes and standards using drawings, schematics, and instructions.
Assemble solar modules, panels, or support structures, as specified.
Accurately layout and install solar racking systems per design on roof mounted systems.
Mount and wire PV modules per specified design.
Identify and resolve any deficiencies in photovoltaic system installation or materials.
Installation of Inverters.
Program, adjust, or configure inverters and controls for desired set points and operating modes.
Installation of battery systems.
Wiring of the Power backup system from Solar panels to Inverters to batteries and clearly labeling all cables and DBs.
Determine materials, equipment, and installation sequences necessary to maximize installation efficiency.
Trunking and cabling works for PV power systems
New Systems commissioning and old systems decommissioning
Adhere to daily and weekly schedules for project activities under the direction of the Senior Engineer.





Qualifications



Diploma/Certificate in Electrical and Electronics engineering, Instrumentations or Renewable Energy
Hands on Experience in Electrical installation works. Those with experience of Solar PV Systems will have an added advantage
Solid knowledge of MERA electrical practices and standards. MERA certification is an added advantage.
Strong knowledge of Site safety practices and standards
Visual thinker good at problem solving and implementing ideas
Experience operating hand and power tools, soldering and fault-testing equipment.





Additional Information



Ability to climb ladders, bend and kneel repeatedly and work at heights and confined spaces
Physically fit and able to carry heavy objects
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Good communication skills.

As a global, multinational, and multicultural organization, EGPAF believes that diversity in the workplace enriches our work and enhances our impact and effectiveness. We believe that employees have the right to work in a climate of mutual respect and integrity that promotes dignity and respect for all, and that enables them to reach their full potential. EGPAF is an equal opportunity employer and affords equal opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to country law requirements, EGPAF complies with US laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the Foundation has facilities.
The Foundation does not charge any fees at any stage of the recruitment process. If you are asked to pay a fee, please contact our hotline by phone (US: dial toll free 888-225-1429; all other countries: collect 770-776-5674), or online (www.reportlineweb.com/pedaids).
Apply Now








To apply for this job please visit jobs.smartrecruiters.com.

title: Mechanic/Driver
company: Nurses and Midwives Council of Malawi
description:
Closes :  June 27, 2025Full TimeLilongwePosted 11 minutes ago

Nurses and Midwives Council of MalawiOverviewNURSES AND MIDWIVES COUNCIL OF MALAWIINTRODUCTION AND BACKGROUND
Nurses and Midwives Council of Malawi (NMCM) is the regulatory body of Nurses and Midwives established in 1966 under the act of parliament Laws of Malawi Cap 36:02. NMCM is mandated to develop, maintain, monitor, evaluate and control the profession of Nursing and Midwifery thereby contributing to the national goal of promoting the health status of Malawians. As a regulatory, NMCM has the role of regulating the education, training and practice, and professional conduct of Nursing and Midwifery
personnel in the country.NMCM is inviting suitably qualified and experienced Malawian Nationals to fill vacant position of Mechanic/Driver tenable at NMCM offices in Lilongwe.The following are the required personnel and work-related traits for the vacant positionJob Title: Mechanic/DriverReporting Arrangements: The Mechanic/Driver will be reporting to the Assistant Administrative Officer.Purpose of the job: To ensure the organization‚Äôs vehicles are properly
maintained, repaired, and safely operated for official assignments,
contributing to the efficiency and reliability of transport services. The key duties and responsibilities for this position include, but, not limited to;a) Carry out repairs of motor vehicles;
b) Conduct planned inspection of motor vehicles as part of preventative
maintenance;
c) Inspect Councils vehicles before and after service;
d) Attend to emergency breakdown;
e) Maintain fleet service records;
f) Driving Council members of staff and visitors as assigned
g) Carrying out physical checkups on the assigned Councils vehicle on daily
basis to ensure that it is kept in good running condition before using or leaving it.
h) Keeping Council vehicles clean all the time both inside and outside.i) Maintaining log book for the vehicle assigned and keeping the log book up
to date.
j) Collecting and delivering mail, packages from/to various stakeholders
including loading and off-loading the items picked.
k) Taking all necessary steps regarding reporting of breakdowns or accidents.
l) Following schedule of Road Tax, COF, Insurance and schedule of routine and
preventive servicing for vehicles. advising supervisor when renewal is due
m) Any other duties as assigned from time to time.REQUIRED COMPETENCIESa. Reliability and Punctuality
b. Attention to Detail
c. Communication skills
d. Safety Awareness
e. Problem Solving
f. Teamwork.Minimum qualifications and experiencea. Minimum of Malawi School Certificate of Education
b. Grade 1 motor vehicle mechanic trade test certificate or city and Guilds
c. and driving license and defensive driving License
d. must have at least four years‚Äô experience in similar position.METHOD OF APPLICATIONInterested applicants should send their application letters and detailed Curriculum Vitae including three traceable referees, including previous employer, not later than June 27, 2025 to:The Registrar, Nurses and Midwives Council of Malawi, P.O Box 30361, Capital City, Lilongwe 3. Email: nmcm@nmcm.org.mwNMCM IS AN EQUAL GENDER BASED OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER AND ONLY 8
SHORTLISTED CANDIDATES WILL BE ACKNOWLEDGED.
To apply for this job email your details to nmcm@nmcm.org.mw

title: Education and Training Specialist
company: Nurses and Midwives Council of Malawi (NMCM)
description:
Closes :  June 27, 2025Full TimeLilongwePosted 55 seconds ago

Nurses and Midwives Council of Malawi (NMCM)Overview¬†NURSES AND MIDWIVES COUNCIL OF MALAWIINTRODUCTION AND BACKGROUNDNurses and Midwives Council of Malawi (NMCM) is the regulatory body of Nurses and Midwives established in 1966 under the act of parliament Laws of Malawi Cap 36:02. NMCM is mandated to develop, maintain, monitor, evaluate and control the profession of Nursing and Midwifery thereby contributing to the national goal of promoting the health status of Malawians. As a regulatory, NMCM has the role of regulating the education, training and practice, and professional conduct of Nursing and Midwifery
personnel in the country.NMCM is inviting suitably qualified and experienced Malawian Nationals to fill vacant position of Education and Training Specialist tenable at NMCM offices in Lilongwe.Job Title: Education and Training SpecialistPurpose of the job: Implementation of education and training regulatory services, the following are the required personnel and work-related traits for the vacant position.a) Participate in preparing Nursing and Midwifery education regulatory services implementation work plans, programs, and budget estimates in line with Council‚Äôs approved strategic and business plans.
b) Communicating to relevant stakeholders about the approved departmental activities and making relevant logistical arrangements in liaising with senior education and training specialist.
c) Communicating any changes that may be affected thereto in order to ensure that stakeholders are abreast of Council‚Äôs education and training
regulatory policies, procedures guidelines rules and regulations for proper implementation at all times in liaising with senior education and training specialist
d) Participate in research, developing and reviewing nursing and midwifery
education and Training regulatory tools, as assigned from time to time.
e) Participate in organizing and facilitating implementation of tailor made meetings, in collaboration and liaison with relevant stakeholders.f) Participate in conducting inspection of nursing/midwifery training institutions to asses/review or evaluate them or their training programs for accreditation eligibility or renewal in respect of their accreditation applications and in line with Council‚Äôs regulatory criteria.
g) Participate in education and training inspection programs of all nursing/ midwifery training institutions twice a year to monitor/ asses/evaluate and enforce compliance with Council‚Äôs education and training standards.
h) Participating in short training programs and orientation sessions for
nursing/midwifery teaching staff to improve their knowledge/ skills/ competences.
i) Participate in identifying names of appropriately qualified co-opted team
members for monitoring and evaluation and accreditations of training institutions.
j) Providing appropriate advice on nursing and midwifery education and
training regulatory matters to all stakeholders for smooth operations of the Council.
k) Producing various periodic reports relating to education and training
regulatory programs and presenting findings and recommendations to the
directorate
l) Attending meetings to represent the interests of the Council and answering
queries relevant to the Council mandates particularly on matters relevant to education and training regulatory services.
m) Any other duties relevant to the job assigned from time to time.¬†REQUIRED COMPETENCIESAbility to prioritize work efficiently and independently;
Strong planning, organizational skills and Excellent in communication,
interpersonal, presentation, facilitation and analytical skills;
Self-motivated, assertive and action oriented;
Strategic thinker and of high integrity;
High level of diplomacy and ability to work with teams;
Strong computer skills¬†Minimum qualification and work experienceA registered nurse midwife with BSc in nursing and midwiferyQualification in Nursing Education, leadership and management.At least two years‚Äô clinical practice experience andFour years‚Äô experience in nursing education at a recognized training institution.Must be currently registered with Nurses and Midwives Council of Malawi.METHOD OF APPLICATIONInterested applicants should send their application letters and detailed Curriculum Vitae including three traceable referees, including previous employer, not later than June 27, 2025 to:The Registrar, Nurses and Midwives Council of Malawi, P.O Box 30361, Capital City, Lilongwe 3.Email: nmcm@nmcm.org.mwNMCM IS AN EQUAL GENDER BASED OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER AND ONLY 8
SHORTLISTED CANDIDATES WILL BE ACKNOWLEDGED.
To apply for this job email your details to nmcm@nmcm.org.mw

title: Marketing, Media and Communications Officer
description:
Lilongwe, Malawi
Posted 4 days ago





Netball Association of Malawi (NAM) 



On behalf or our valued client, Netball Association of Malawi (NAM), we invite applications from suitably qualified persons to be considered for the position of Marketing, Media and ¬†Communications Officer.
Background
Netball Association of Malawi (NAM) is an affiliate of the Malawi National Council of Sports, and it is the governing body of netball in Malawi with its national secretariat in Lilongwe with four subcommittees namely, Northern Region Netball Committee, Central region Netball Committee, Southern Region netball Committee. Netball Association of Malawi (NAM) is responsible for governing the sport of netball while the committees are responsible for supervision of NAM regional matters. NAM is desirous of improving its NAM Secretariat operations and is therefore inviting applications from suitably qualified persons to be considered for the positions below
MARKETING, MEDIA AND ¬†COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER
About the Role:
This is a fast-paced roll, the individual will be a vital member of our Marketing department, supporting all aspects of campaign development, digital marketing execution, and event coordination. He/ She will wear many hats, leveraging creativity, analytical skills, and organizational prowess to drive brand awareness and achieve marketing goals.
Duties and Responsibilities:

Lead on NAMs digital marketing, managing paid advertising, email marketing.
Work with digital and TV partners to ensure obligations of NAM in relation to marketing, branding and communications are met.
Contributes to the creation of marketing materials, campaigns, content, and managing of NAM social media including monitoring and reporting on the effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns.
Help plan, create, and monitor content and edit marketing materials, including brochures, flyers, and social media posts.
Create marketing campaigns that boost the NAMs fundraising events, partners and sponsors programmes, and demonstrates the impact that sponsorship has on our programmes and netball community.
Lead on the marketing and communications for all tournaments and national teams‚Äô commitments including managing all such operational communications.
Manage the Association‚Äôs email databases and assist in maintaining the Associations website activities, updates and improving reach.
Produce strong written copies for both digital and printed media and engage and handle media enquiries with media personnel as required.
To generate and deliver content including the filming and editing of long and short form multimedia, editing of game footage, and creation of highlight clips (from third party or own filmed content).
Actively seek opportunities to raise the profile of the sport through sharing of participants personal journeys and bringing the sport to life.
Marketing and communications event support ‚Äì proposal and creation of fan engagement opportunities to maximize attendance at NAM events and retention of fans
Plan, organize, coordinate player appearances, external media events, event logistics, promotional.
Liaise with all print, TV and radio stations for all NAM and National team commitments

Qualifications Experience and Skills:

Degree/ Diploma in Marketing, Journalism, Communications, or a related field with a major in Marketing and Communications with CIM qualification
At least 3 years‚Äô experience in a marketing or communications role, with digital marketing experience preferable.
Proficiency in digital marketing tools (e.g., Google Analytics, social media management platforms).
Experience in the successful execution of marketing and communications activities.
Experience of developing digital channels and/or delivering social media strategies and campaigns
Must have a creative flair with a strategic approach to marketing, basic understanding of marketing principles and market research techniques.
Experience of working in a busy brand marketing and/or communications function
Ability to write strong and engaging copy for digital or printed platforms
Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.

Interested candidates should submit their applications with CVs, copies of their certificates plus at least three traceable referees not later than 9th July 2025 using this link: https://forms.gle/hYnYzJgSrPumEQnL9




To apply for this job please visit forms.gle.

title: Field Officer (2)
description:
Full Time
Balaka and Zomba
Posted 5 days ago





Girls Empowerment Network (GENET) 




Job Title: Field Officer 
Project: Acting Together for Responsive and Integrated Systems for children‚Äôs access to education in Emergencies¬†
Location: 1 in Balaka and1 Zomba
Contract Type: Fixed Term
Duration: 21 months
Reporting to: Technical Coordinator (AA / Child Protection & MHPSS)
Start Date: As soon as possible
Project Overview: ECHO ARISE
The Acting Together for Responsive and Integrated Systems for Children‚Äôs Access to Education in Emergencies (ARISE) is an ECHO HIP funded 2-year regional program that aims to enhance girls‚Äô and boys‚Äô access to safe, protective, inclusive and uninterrupted learning and supportive services for their well-being during crises in Malawi and Zimbabwe. The project specifically aims to strengthen the education and protection systems (at regional, national, district and community level) to proactively anticipate, prepare, adapt and respond to multi hazard shocks while utilizing an integrated approachthat brings together Education in Emergencies (EiE), Child Protection in Humanitarian Action (CPHA) and Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS) to ensure there is comprehensive continuity of learning for girls and boys in safe, protective, supportive and inclusive environments during crisis, as part of addressing the SADCs 2024 Drought Appeal‚Äôs concern regarding education disruption and child wellbeing.
ARISE prioritizes inclusion through targeted support for vulnerable groups, especially girls, out of school children and children with disabilities, responding to ECHO HIP 2025 Pillar II on EiE as well as strengthening the priorities of Pillar 1 and 3.¬† ARISE has also prioritized comprehensive locally-led preparedness, anticipatory action and rapid response of multi-hazard shocks.
ARISE project is led by Save the Children, and in Malawi will be implemented in Zomba and Balaka districts by Girls Empowerment Network (GENET) in collaboration with the Ministry of Basic and Secondary Education.
Purpose of the Role
Field Officers will be responsible for day-to-day implementation, community engagement, monitoring, and supportof education, child protection, MHPSS, and anticipatory action activities at community and school levels. They will serve as the critical link between the project team and local communities, schools, and government structures.
Key Responsibilities

 Activity Implementation


Support delivery of project activities across EiE, child protection, MHPSS, and anticipatory action components.
Facilitate training sessions for learners, teachers, caregivers, community leaders, and youth groups.
Monitor implementation of school safety plans, MHPSS initiatives, and early action protocols.


 Community Mobilization and Engagement


Mobilize community members, learners, teachers, and child protection committees to participate in project activities.
Promote inclusive participation, especially of girls, women, and vulnerable groups.
Support formation and strengthening of community-based child protection and early warning structures.


 Early Warning and Preparedness


Support communities and schools in identifying local hazards, mapping risks, and applying early warning indicators.
Participate in the dissemination and activation of anticipatory action messages and triggers.


 Case Identification and Referral


Identify and refer children in need of protection, MHPSS support, or other services through established pathways.
Work with community case workers, mentors, and frontline responders to monitor follow-ups.


 Data Collection and Reporting


Conduct regular monitoring visits and collect data using digital tools (e.g., Kobo, ODK).
Provide accurate and timely reports to Technical Coordinators.
Document lessons learned, success stories, and challenges from the field.


 Coordination and Representation


Represent the project at community-level meetings and interface platforms.
Liaise with school committees, mother groups, traditional and faith leaders, and government extension workers to foster ownership and collaboration.

Qualifications and Experience

Diploma or degree in Community Development, Social Work, Disaster Risk Management, or related field.
At least 2 years‚Äô experience in community-level project implementation (EiE, child protection, or resilience programming).
Experience working in rural Malawian settings with schools, youth, and community structures.
Basic knowledge of child safeguarding, MHPSS, and early warning systems.
Fluent in Chichewa and English (spoken and written).
Must be a resident of or familiar with Balaka or Zomba District.

Key Competencies

Strong facilitation and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.
Familiarity with participatory training and child-friendly communication methods.
Proficiency in mobile data collection (Kobo, ODK) and Microsoft Office.
Commitment to gender equality, child protection, and safeguarding.

CHILD SAFEGUARDING: 
Level 3: the responsibility of this post requires the post holder to have regular contact with children especially adolescent girls and boys, children with disabilities and other vulnerable groups of children. This is expected to be done frequently and intensively during the implementation of this project in the impact areas in Malawi. As such, the post holder is expected to have a clean child safeguarding record as well as the required practical skills for level 3 of child safeguarding.
How to apply
Please submit your CV and a cover letter detailing your suitability for the role to recruitment@genetmalawi.org by 11th July, 2025 5pm CAT. Please include Field Officer‚Äì ECHO ARISE in the subject line.

title: Stores Clerk
description:
Opportunity
Lilongwe, Malawi
Posted 18 seconds ago
Closes: May 26, 2025




Shayona Cement Corporation 




Stores Clerk at Shayona Cement Corporation. Lilongwe, Malawi








Overview







VACANCY ANNOUNCEMENT
¬†
Shayona Cement Corporation¬†is inviting suitably qualified and experienced persons to fill the vacant position of Stores Clerk. Location: Lilongwe ‚Äì Kanengo
¬†
Stores Clerk (1 Post)
Prerequisites

Diploma in Procurement and Supply Chain Management or any other related qualification
Malawi School Certificate of Education
Two years‚Äô work experience on a similar position

¬†
Key responsibilities;

Receive, inspect and store incoming goods
Manage inventory levels and optimize storage space
Dispatch goods to internal departments
Maintain accurate records of inventory and transactions
Collaborate with colleagues to ensure smooth operations
Identify and report discrepancies or issues to Superiors
Assisting in stock taking
Preparation of daily/monthly reports
Maintaining clean and safe store.

¬†
Requirements;

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Basic computer skills and familiarity with inventory management software
Physically ability to lift and move goods

¬†
Interested persons should apply, enclosing their curriculum vitae and photocopy/scanned certificates with two traceable referees to;
Human Resources Officer,
Shayona Cement Corporation,
P.O. Box 679,
Lilongwe.
Email:¬†slhr1@shayonacement.com
Only shortlisted applicants will be communicated for interviews and closing date for receiving applications is 26th¬†May 2025.








Tagged as: Procurement and Supply Chain Jobs 



To apply for this job email your details to slhr1@shayonacement.com.

title: Sales and Service Representative
description:
Opportunity
Karonga, Malawi
Posted 18 seconds ago
Closes: June 2, 2025




VITALITE 




Sales and Service Representative at VITALITE. Karonga, Malawi





About Us

Quality Made Affordable

¬†
Job Description

¬†
Are you up for a challenge and looking to join a growing start-up? VITALITE Sales department is looking for a sales & service representative to be based in Karonga (Rural), Northern Region of Malawi.

We are looking for a highly motivated, hard-working and enthusiastic individual who is able to assist our distribution team in with their sales and servicing responsibilities. You will be responsible for recruiting and maintaining a large and diverse group of resellers. You will also be responsible for oversight and warehousing of inventory to be sold by the resellers.¬†


Requirements

Key Characteristics

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Sales & Marketing experience.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Proven sales track record.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Basic understanding of Accounting.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Diploma in business related programs
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Professional & Proactive attitude.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Comfortable in an independent role.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Must be highly organized and poses an ability to multi-task.

¬†Motorcycle license and proven track record handling a motorcycle. You will be required to operate a motorcycle on a daily basis.

Additional Requirements¬†
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent interpersonal skills.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Must be a team player.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Must be able to multi-task.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong problem solving skills.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Critical thinking.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Must be able to provide good customer service and client relationship.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Degree in area of business a plus
‚Äã
Do you match the above-mentioned requirements?¬†
Please send your full application package¬†(*1 document*)¬†including:
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúWhat 3 Marketing tools in rural areas would you make use of in order to increase sales?‚Äù (min. 200words).¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Include where you saw the advert.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†CV and cover letter.
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†3 References (previous employers)
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Copy of any academic certificates ‚Äì combine in application¬†(PDF).¬†¬†¬†
‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strictly those residing in Karonga
‚Äã

Benefits
Benefits of the role may include access to a company motorbike for work-related travel. Additionally, the position involves the use of a tablet and cell phone (with airtime/data), provided by the company, to facilitate daily tasks.




Tagged as: Sales and Marketing Jobs

title: Invitation for Bids ‚Äì Design and Printing of A4 Guide and A5 Leaflet
description:
Other
Lilongwe, Malawi
Posted 3 days ago





Population Services International (PSI) 



Invitation for Bids
The Government of Malawi has received a Financial Contribution from the Federal Republic of Germany through German Development Bank (hereinafter referred to as ‚ÄúKfW‚Äù), to increase access to quality sexual and reproductive health services through the Programme for Reproductive Health. It is intended that parts of the proceeds of this Contribution will be applied to eligible payments under contract for procurement of Goods and Services for which this invitation for bids is issued.
Bidding will be conducted by means of the National Competitive Bidding procedure with qualification as specified in KfW‚Äôs Procurement Guidelines (‚ÄúKfW Guidelines‚Äù). The bidding will be conducted in accordance to the KfW‚Äôs ‚ÄúGuidelines for Procurement of various consultancy Services‚Äù and the relevant regulations of the Government of Malawi. The bidding is open to all national companies.
The Bidding comprises the following items:



Lot
ITEM DESCRIPTION
QUANTITY


1
Designing and Printing of an A4 Chichewa Menstrual Health Communication Guide for Community Mobilisers
400


2
Designing and Printing of an A5 Menstrual Cup Leaflet
21,000



Bidders can only bid for any one of the two Lots. The bid and must offer all items in full quantity under each Lot. Contracts will be issued based on lot.
The Chairman of the Internal Procurement Committee of PSI Branch Office in Malawi now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the printing of A4 Menstrual Health Communication Guide for N‚Äôzatonse Project Mobilisers and A5 Menstrual Cup Leaflet. Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information in respect of the bidding documents through email to:
Population Services International
Malawi Branch Office
2nd Floor, ADL House, City Center
P.O. Box 30914, Capital City, Lilongwe, Malawi
Email: bidenquiries@psimw.org
¬†
A complete set of Bidding Document may be obtained from 27 May to 10 June 2025 by any interested eligible bidder upon the submission of a written request through email to:
¬†Population Services International
Malawi Branch Office
2nd Floor, ADL House, City Center
P.O. Box 30914, Capital City, Lilongwe, Malawi.
Email: bidenquiries@psimw.org
All the bids must be delivered in the tender box at or be posted by registered courier to the office of the address below, on or before 10.00am on 20th June 2025.
Internal Procurement Committee
Population Services International
2nd Floor, ADL House, City Centre
P O Box 30914
Capital City, Lilongwe, Malawi.
Bids will be opened in the presence of Bidders or their representative who choose to attend on the same day at PSI Office in Malawi
As the Authority competent to accept the tender, the tender committee on behalf of the Project Execution Agencies reserves the right to accept or reject one or all the Bids without assigning any reason thereof. Award of the Contract will be subject to approval by PSI and or KFW.
Summary of main bidding conditions 



Bid validity:
120 calendar days


Delivery period:
4 weeks to final destination


Bid currency:
Malawi Kwacha


Copy of bid:
One original and One copy

title: Procurement Officer
description:
Full Time
Lilongwe, Malawi
Posted 22 hours ago





Export Development Fund (EDF) 



Organisation Background
Export Development Fund (EDF) is a development finance institution (DFI) mandated to promote the growth as well as diversification of the country‚Äôs exports. EDF‚Äôs mission is to support the Malawi economy through provision of foreign trade solutions to facilitate export diversification, international competitiveness and inclusive growth.
EDF also plays a leading role in job creation by investing in ambitious projects and initiatives, with the aim of enhancing the competitiveness of Malawi‚Äôs exports.
EDF‚Äôs young and dynamic team is motivated towards the collective goal of transforming Malawi‚Äôs exporting sector for accelerated economic development.
An exciting opportunity has arisen for energetic and innovative individuals to join EDF. We are therefore inviting applications from suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions:
PROCUREMENT OFFICER
Reporting to the Procurement & Administration Specialist, the Procurement Officer is responsible for providing support in procurement and administration processes, transactions, and activities.
Key responsibilities include the following:

Supporting the Procurement and Administration Specialist in providing secretarial duties for the Internal Procurement and Disposal Committee (IPDC).
Development of procurement and disposal documentation such as annual procurement and disposal plan, tender documents, procurement contracts, adverts and invitations.
Enforcing adherence to company policies, regulations, and legal requirements governing public procurement and disposal of assets
Identifying, evaluating and selecting capable and reliable suppliers.
Preparing negotiating terms, conditions, and arranging negotiation meetings with suppliers to secure the best value.
Analyzing costs, identifying cost-saving opportunities, and managing procurement budgets
Maintaining accurate records of purchases, pricing, and supplier information.
Building and maintaining strong relationships with key suppliers.
Preparing reports on procurement and disposal activities for internal as well as external requirements.
Managing the tenancy agreements and all EDF‚Äôs obligations in the agreements
Processing fringe benefits for members of staff including fuel, airtime and security services.
Planning and organizing company events and meetings.
Overseeing daily activities, including coordinating logistics schedules and minor office repairs.
Monitoring stock levels for stationery and office supplies, manage inventory databases, and track incoming and outgoing goods.

Preferred Qualifications, Skills, Experience and Attributes are as follows:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Procurement and Logistics Management, Business Administration, Economics, or equivalent.
Advanced Diploma in Procurement and Supply Chain (Chartered Institute of Procurement and Supplies -CIPS)
Member of the Malawi Institute of Procurement and Supply (MIPS)

Reporting to the Manager, Origination & Special Projects, the Investment Specialist is responsible for leading end-to-end operations of business development, due diligence, and the credit risk management processes for high efficiency processes and quality loan book. St John of God Hospitaller Services 



St John of God Hospitaller Services Malawi is a non-profit faith-based healthcare organization established in 1994 to contribute to the development of health for all Malawians including the most vulnerable, marginalized and excluded groups. With its operations in both Lilongwe and Mzuzu, St John of God Malawi is a key provider of tertiary and community based mental health promotion and care; early intervention services, special need and inclusive education for children with both intellectual and physical disability; vocational training for orphans & vulnerable youth including those with disability; health care and ancillary services for older persons; psychosocial counselling, stress and addiction management services; rehabilitation of street children; self-help group approach for women empowerment and tertiary level training in Psychiatric Nursing, Clinical Medicine- Psychiatry & Mental Health, Psychosocial Counselling and General Nursing.
SJOG would like to fill the following positions based in Mzuzu:
Electrical Technician
Reporting to the Maintenance Officer, the Electrical Technician will be responsible for installing, maintaining, troubleshooting, and repairing electrical systems and equipment-ensuring uninterrupted power supply and compliance with safety standards to support hospital operations and patient care.
Duties and Responsibilities

Installation of electrical appliances.
Identify and repair electrical faults.
Carry out Comprehensive house and hospital equipment inspection.
Compile monthly reports on electrical issues.
Repair some hospital equipment.
Maintain and apply safe working practices to prevent accidents.
Conduct a routine check on electrical appliances.

Requirements

Malawi School Certificate of Education
Electrical Certificate or City and Guilds Certificate.
Those with Diploma in Electrical Engineering will have an added advantage.
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar position.
Hands-on experience of Electrical Work is an added advantage.
Strict adherence to the Organisation‚Äôs Child and Vulnerable Adult protection policy
Willingness to work with people suffering from mental health related problems and their families.

The Chief Executive Officer,

MZUZU

Closing date: Friday, 30th May, 2025.
